Job Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst - Claims Platform
Ad Text:
Location: Brisbane or Sydney or Melbourne

Support Claims Platform upgrades and small API integrations
Join a 250-strong Analysis Chapter with masterclasses and shared learning
Flexible hybrid working and access to award-winning employee benefits

Help shape the future of the claims platform by working on enhancements and upgrades that improve our customer experience and operational efficiency.

About the Role

We’re looking for a technically minded Senior Technical Business Analyst to support the delivery of system upgrades, enhancements across our Claims Platform as well as supporting API integration with other applications. You’ll join a dynamic, collaborative team within our 250-member Analysis Chapter, where knowledge sharing and continuous improvement are part of our DNA.

 

What You’ll Do

Collaborate with architects, developers, and stakeholders to requirements
Document current and future state processes, identifying opportunities for process improvement, automation or simplification
Facilitate workshops and stakeholder sessions to elicit, validate, and prioritise business needs
Create detailed user stories and artefacts to support Agile delivery
Coach and support other analysts, contributing to chapter-wide initiatives and best practice

 

What You’ll Bring

10+ years’ experience as a Senior Business Analyst, ideally in insurance or financial services
Strong technical understanding of Guidewire Claims Centre
Proven ability to simplify complex information and communicate clearly with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience working in Agile and hybrid delivery environments using tools like JIRA and Confluence
Ability to lead workshops, manage dependencies, and drive outcomes across cross-functional teams
A collaborative mindset and passion for continuous improvement

 

What You’ll Enjoy

Access our award-winning Shine platform – your central hub for exclusive perks, wellbeing support, career development, and recognition. Shine has been recognised for excellence in employee experience, making it easier than ever to access what matters most to you.

Hybrid working, flexible leave, 20 weeks paid parental leave, and up to 5 days paid flexible leave annually
Paid study support, career breaks, on-the-job learning, and a $1,000 referral bonus for eligible employees
Free wellbeing coaching, a dedicated Employee Council, and confidential EAP access
Discounts at 400+ retailers, insurance savings, gym memberships, and reduced super fees
Paid volunteer leave, donation matching, and unlimited emergency response leave
Performance-based bonuses and Suncorp shares for eligible employees
Diversity is celebrated through employee resource groups and inclusive policies for all families

Explore our full benefits: www.suncorpgroup.com.au/careers/benefits

At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

If you require any support and adjustments to participate equitably in our recruitment process or in the workplace, we encourage you to contact melissa.turkington@suncorp.com.au for a confidential conversation.

About the Role:

Independent Schools Queensland (ISQ) is seeking a dynamic and visionary Head of Advisory & Strategic Projects to drive the growth and delivery of our advisory services to schools. This is a senior leadership role where you’ll design, promote, and continuously improve high-impact advisory solutions—helping schools thrive and ensuring sustainable business growth for ISQ.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead Advisory Projects: Facilitate workshops, coordinate stakeholder consultations, conduct research and analysis, and deliver high-quality advisory reports tailored to the needs of Queensland independent schools.

Drive Business Growth: Identify and execute strategies to expand ISQ’s advisory services, monitor market trends, and contribute to thought leadership in the education sector.

Deliver Strategic Projects: Oversee key ISQ initiatives, manage project planning and risk, and engage stakeholders to ensure successful outcomes.

Foster Collaboration: Build strong relationships with internal teams, schools, and external partners, championing a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.

A full position description is available on our website. Please visit www.isq.qld.edu.au/about/work-with-us/

About you

We’re looking for someone with:

Experience: At least 8 years in business consulting, with a proven track record in business development and advisory services. Experience in the independent school or not-for-profit sector is highly regarded.

Qualifications: Tertiary qualifications in Business, Management, or a related field (post-graduate qualifications are a plus).

Skills: Exceptional leadership, analytical, and problem-solving abilities. Strong communication, facilitation, and stakeholder management skills. Strategic thinker with a results-oriented mindset and a passion for continuous improvement.

Attributes: Collaborative, innovative, and committed to building a positive staff culture.

About us

Independent Schools Queensland (ISQ) is the peak body representing Queensland's independent schooling sector. We represent over 200 diverse member schools across Queensland, and these range from small community schools to large Prep to Year 12 schools and cater for families from a variety of social and economic backgrounds. ISQ provides a united and powerful voice representing and promoting the interests of member schools to governments and the wider community, fostering choice in education and protecting the autonomy of independent schools. Our mission is to champion independent education and to support independent schools to serve their communities. ISQ is a non-profit membership organisation with more than 50 years’ experience at the forefront of education innovation.

ISQ has a commitment to reconciliation, and our Reconciliation Action Plan can be viewed on our website.

Why Join Us?

Lead meaningful projects that impact schools and communities.

Be part of a supportive, forward-thinking team.

Beautiful office environment

Flexible work options including working from home arrangements up to 2 day per week

Competitive remuneration package

Opportunity to salary package some personal expenses

Focus on personal and career development opportunities

If you are ready to make a difference and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we would love to hear from you!

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the perfect fit for this role. Please contact Rachel Wolfson, HR Business Partner on 07 3228 1519 if you have any queries. Applications close 4pm 24 November 2025.

We will review applications as they are received and may commence interviewing prior to the closing date, therefore candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible.

We are not inviting assistance from Recruitment Agents at this time.

This is an excellent opportunity for an energetic, dynamic Commercial Analyst to join a successful, Aussie company.

Reporting into the CFO you'll act as a business partner to operational stakeholders, providing commercial, financial & analytical support, to help drive decisions & business performance.

Your analytical scope will encompass areas such as category sales, discounting, gross margins, pre & post promotional analysis and wages. You'll create financial models in order to provide meaningful insights into business performance issues, challenging decisions where necessary.

You'll also prepare and distribute weekly & monthly reports, with associated commentary, for use by the business. And will hold regular meetings with Category Managers and the Commercial Director, to review monthly sales, margin results etc.

Additionally, you'll play a key role in business planning for new stores, budgeting, forecasting and other ad hoc analysis when required.

You are an up-and-coming Financial or Commercial Analyst, with recent, extensive experience in a similar role. 

You'll have proven analytical skills, combined with a background in business partnering. You will also have advanced Excel / modelling skills, whilst experience using a BI tool such as TM1 will be well regarded.

For more information, please contact Schenuk Wijesekera on 02 9775 5916. Or to apply, hit the "apply" button.
